text: {"grade": 1, "reasoning": "The response addresses shared responsibility by stating, 'Since the outbuilding was shared, you should show that you had clear agreements with the other company regarding safety responsibilities. This could include clauses in your lease agreement that specify who is responsible for what aspects of safety.' Furthermore, in the 'Primary Blame' section, it notes, 'While both companies share some responsibility, the company that brought in the equipment that caused the fire is likely to bear the primary blame... However, as the owner of the building, your company might also be held partially responsible if it can be shown that you did not take reasonable steps to ensure the safety of all equipment used in the building.' This directly implies that liability may be apportioned between the owner (the candidate's company) and the tenant (the neighbor) due to shared control and potential failure to cooperate on safety obligations, satisfying the criterion.", "criterion_id": "e230acad-079d-4755-a895-6b8e56fa4390"}
